result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 12/30/2019, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 12/30/2019, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  *8/23/2016 Credit amended to 453 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

-No alcohol or controlled substances.
-No contact  with Lonnie J or DeAir B. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

DOC request to review JOC for excessive sentence credit.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is disregarding the PSI dated 1/14/16 and using the report dated 4/13/16. There are no corrections to the PSI.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 462 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 12/30/2019, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 12/30/2019, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact  with Lonnie J or DeAir B. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Part time work or school
-20 hours of community service
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for defense motion to withdraw guilty plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense withdraws defense motion.  Colloquy held between the court and defendant.  
Parties stipulate to the use of presentence investigation report previously filed.  Case set for sentencing before Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court finds that the defense has met the threshold and grants their motion for an evidenciary hearing. Case calendared for MOTION HEARING in Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin for Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for competency hearing.  State does not challenge Dr. Collin's report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Collin's report.  Defendant states that he is not competent to proceed.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. Debra Collins.  Exhibit 1 marked, offered by the state and received by the Court.

Case recall.  Sworn for defense: Demetrius Nelson.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.  After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Collins and testimony of Dr. Collins, Court finds defendant competent to proceed at this time.  Court ordered proceedings unsuspended and cash bail of $1,000.00 reinstated.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing regarding defense motion to withdraw plea in Branch 15.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
dated 3-30-16 from Attorney Anthony D. Cotton, received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on return of doctor's report. Defense is contesting the doctor's report. Case is calendared for COMPETENCY HEARING in Branch 15.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed Wisconsin Forensic Report.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case calendared for DOCTOR'S REPORT RETURN  in Branch 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript of 11/9/15 PLEA HEARING, 24 pages, received and filed. sab
Filed by Attorney Robert Lee Taylor, Defendant's Motion For Competency Examination
Filed by Attorney Robert Lee Taylor, Defendant's Motion To Withdraw Guilty Plea
The Court ordered a presentence investigation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. State requests an adjournment. Defense does not object. Discussions regarding the PSI placed on the record. Court receives judgment of conviction from Illinois. Court orders a copy of the plea transcript. Court requets a clean copy of the PSI with no recomendation. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing and sentencing in Branch 15.
Certified Statement of Conviction / Disposition received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  On motion of the State, Court ordered the "Repeater" enhancer DISMISSED. Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court ordered a Presentence Report at the defense request. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendar for Jury Trial.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, defense requests another final pre-trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15 for Jury Trial on November 9, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 10/16/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 11/9/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. Defense counsel was just appointed on yesterdays date and needs time to review the discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 8/14/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Opland-Dobs is moving to withdraw at the request of defendant due to a breakdown in communication.  The court will grant the motion and allow counsel to withdraw.  New counsel to be appointed by SPD.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502SB.  Case is set for status of counsel.
  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned to 7-21-2015 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/18/2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Michael Jude, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed on 5-18-2015.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.    The state informs the court that the discovery has not been compiled yet and is requesting a couple weeks to get discovery to defense counsel and an offer made.
Case is adjourned to 6-11-2015 at 8:15 for status.

CASE RESCHEDULED TO MAY 26, 2015 AT 8:15 A.M. FOR AN ARRAIGNMENT IN BRANCH 38, JUDGE WAGNER. 
ALL PARTIES INFORMED.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Michael Jude for Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to the defendant's previous conviction in Illinois Cook County case #14CF1853801 is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the state:Jeffrey Sullivan-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy.  Defense Counsel requests an Arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Demetrius Dee Nelson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
